text: The following is a list of popes by length of reign. It is split into the longest 11 and the shortest 11 reigns. ==Popes== The term pope is the name several churches give to their highest spiritual leader. In English, the term usually means the head of the Catholic Church. The most accurate information about the popes is published every year by the Holy See in the . ==Popes with the longest reigns== Including Peter, who was the first Bishop of Rome and the first pope, the list of the 11 longest-reigning popesCatholic Encyclopedia, "List of Popes"; retrieved 2011-11-9. includes: # Saint Peter (30–64 AD or 33–67 AD): 34 years. # Pope Pius IX (1846–1878):"Pope Pius IX," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 31 years, 7 months and 23 days (11,560 days). # Pope John Paul II (1978–2005): 26 years, 5 months and 17 days (9,665 days) # Pope Leo XIII (1878–1903):"Pope Leo XIII," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 25 years, 5 months and 1 day (9,281 days). # Pope Pius VI (1775–1799):"Pope Pius VI," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 24 years, 6 months and 15 days (8,962 days). # Pope Adrian I (772–795):"Pope Adrian I," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 23 years, 10 months and 25 days (8,729 days). # Pope Pius VII (1800–1823):"Pope Pius VII," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 23 years, 5 months and 7 days (8,560 days). # Pope Alexander III (1159–1181):"Pope Alexander III," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 21 years, 11 months and 24 days (8,029 days). # Pope Sylvester I (314–335):"Pope Sylvester I (314-335)," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 21 years, 11 months and 1 day (8,005 days). # Pope Leo I (440–461):"Pope St. Leo I (the Great)," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 21 years, 1 month, and 13 days. (7,713 days). # Pope Urban VIII (1623–1644):"Pope Urban VIII," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. 20 years, 11 months and 24 days (7,664 days). ==Popes with the shortest reigns== The list of the 11 shortest-reigning popes includes: # Pope Urban VII (September 15–September 27, 1590):"Pope Urban VII," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. reigned for 13 calendar days, died before consecration. # Pope Boniface VI (April, 896):"Pope Boniface VI," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. reigned for 16 calendar days # Pope Celestine IV (October 25–November 10, 1241):"Pope Celestine IV," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-3. reigned for 17 calendar days, died before consecration. # Pope Theodore II (December, 897):"Pope Theodore II," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-3. reigned for 20 calendar days # Pope Sisinnius (January 15–February 4, 708):"Pope Sisinnius," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-3. reigned for 21 calendar days # Pope Marcellus II (April 9–May 1, 1555):"Pope Marcellus II," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-3. reigned for 22 calendar days # Pope Damasus II (July 17–August 9, 1048):"Pope Damasus II", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-8. reigned for 24 calendar days # Pope Pius III (September 22–October 18, 1503):"Pope Pius III," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. reigned for 27 calendar days. # Pope Leo XI (April 1–April 27, 1605):"Pope Leo XI", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. reigned for 27 calendar days # Pope Benedict V (May 22–June 23, 964):"Pope Benedict V," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-9. reigned for 33 calendar days. # Pope John Paul I (August 26–September 28, 1978): reigned for 33 calendar days."Obituaries: The Smiling Pope," New York Times.
